verses.roman:
tabe digvijayī vyākhyāra śloka puchila
śata ślokera eka śloka prabhu ta' paḍila

synonyms: tabe—thereafter; dig-vijayī—Keśava Kāśmīrī; vyākhyāra—for explanation; śloka—a verse; puchila—inquired about; śata—one hundred; ślokera—of the verses; eka—one; śloka—verse; prabhu—the Lord; ta'-then; paḍila—recited.
translation: The Digvijayī, Keśava Kāśmīrī, inquired which verse He wanted explained. The Lord then recited one of the one hundred verses Keśava Kāśmīrī had composed.
